September 22, 2016 <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/meet-pivotal-cloud-foundry-1-8-because-time-to-value-is-contagious]]> PCF 1.8: Because Time to Value is Contagious The new Pivotal Cloud Foundry 1.8 release delivers more power and flexibility to improve the critical measure of time to value when delivering software. Now more legacy systems, IoT services, and containerized apps can be run on PCF. Learn More <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/meet-pivotal-cloud-foundry-1-8-because-time-to-value-is-contagious]]> <[[https://medium.com/built-to-adapt/asking-for-gender-in-applications-687a3ba2cea8#.caq9qrkid]]> Asking for Gender in Applications Pivotal Labs engineer Zoe Gagnon discusses how to approach an inclusive gender question when building applications. The post includes guidelines for how to create a gender form. Read Now <[[https://medium.com/built-to-adapt/asking-for-gender-in-applications-687a3ba2cea8#.caq9qrkid]]> <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-conversations/features/034-building-diy-platforms-now-youve-got-two]]> Save Millions of Dollars This week, hosts Coté and Richard Seroter interview Matt Walburn, who recently worked on a DIY platform project. He talks about the lure of the DIY platform and why, now that options like Pivotal Cloud Foundry are available, it's usually a poor use of organizational time (and money).
